travelers.notes: Business partners (travel agents) and BFFs. Both in 50s, experienced travelers, foodies, good physical health. First time to Portugal. Scouting trip to learn destination for future client sales.

preferences.vibe: Pack it full — culture, food, scenic villages, beaches, shopping. Dual purpose: personal adventure + business reconnaissance.
preferences.budget: Cost-conscious with selective splurges for right experiences
preferences.mobility: No restrictions. Kim prefers shorter car rides (no long drives).
preferences.transportation: Train-based itinerary. No rental car. Day trips from two bases.
mustHave: Shopping - fashion for Susie, unique/off-beaten-path for Kim
See key tourist spots to understand for future clients
avoid: Rental car if practical to skip

routing.reasoning: Kim has Delta status, earns miles. JFK has premium lounges.

itinerary.summary: Two bases (Lisbon 4 nights, Porto 4 nights) with day trips by train. No rental car.

days.title: Arrive Lisbon
days.dining: Easy dinner near hotel - try Martinho da Arcada (Lisbon's oldest café, since 1782)

days.title: Lisbon Exploration + Food Tour
days.dining: Food tour covers lunch. Evening: Taberna da Rua das Flores or Cervejaria Ramiro (seafood)
days.valueTierNote: Value option: Skip food tour, do DIY food crawl instead

days.title: Sintra Day Trip
days.dining: Lunch in Sintra village. Dinner back in Lisbon: Prado (farm-to-table, vegan options)

days.title: Cascais Beach Day
days.dining: Seafood lunch in Cascais. Dinner: Fado show at Tasca do Chico or Sr. Fado
days.valueTierNote: Value option: Tasca do Chico fado bar (~€5 cover + drinks) vs dinner show

days.title: Train to Porto
days.dining: Dinner with river views: Bacalhau or Adega São Nicolau
days.valueTierNote: Value option: Book Promo fare (as low as €9.50/person vs €34)

days.title: Porto Exploration + Food Tour
days.dining: Food tour covers tastings. Dinner: Tapabento at São Bento Station

days.title: Douro Valley Scenic Train
days.dining: Lunch in Pinhão riverside. Dinner: Francesinha at Café Santiago or Lado B

days.title: Porto Free Day
days.dining: Special farewell dinner: Raiz or Ora Viva

locations.name: Lisbon
locations.purpose: Capital city base. Day trips to Sintra and Cascais.

locations.name: Porto
locations.purpose: Northern base. Walkable city, Douro day trip.

lodging.recommendation: Premium tier recommended - best value for quality/location balance. Value tier available for budget-conscious option.

value.notes: Solid 3-star, less charm but great location. Walking distance to everything.
Budget-friendly without feeling cheap. 10-min walk to Ribeira.

valueTierAlternative.name: DIY Lisbon Food Crawl
valueTierAlternative.note: Save ~$100-120 but miss the guided context and hidden spots

lisbon.name: Sintra Small-Group Tour
lisbon.note: Keep this for both tiers - logistics in Sintra are tricky and palaces require advance booking

valueTierAlternative.name: DIY Porto Food Crawl
valueTierAlternative.note: Great option since they'll have done a guided tour in Lisbon already

porto.name: DIY Douro Valley Scenic Train
porto.note: Perfect for Susie - scenic without wine focus. Same for both tiers.
porto.warning: ⚠️ Track work until April 2, 2026 - verify closer to trip

premium.name: Sr. Fado Dinner Show
premium.note: More formal, excellent performers, full dinner included

value.name: Tasca do Chico
value.note: More authentic amateur fado. Reserve ahead. Eat dinner elsewhere first, then go for the show.

pricing.promo: Up to 65% off if booked 5-60 days advance

value.note: Book 30-60 days ahead at cp.pt for best prices

booking.tip: Book early for Promo fares - can be as low as €9.50

lisbonToPorto.note: Seat reservation included. No standing allowed.

portoToDouro.tip: Sit on RIGHT side for best river views
portoToDouro.warning: ⚠️ Track work until April 2, 2026 - verify closer to trip

cascais.tip: Scenic coastal route - sit on left

departureDay.route: Porto Campanhã → Lisboa Oriente → Metro to Airport

lisbon.name: Cervejaria Ramiro
lisbon.note: Famous - go for lunch to avoid crowds

lisbon.name: Martinho da Arcada
lisbon.note: Lisbon's oldest café - great for arrival day

lisbon.name: Alfama Cellar
lisbon.mustTry: Best seafood rice in Lisbon, oxtail
lisbon.note: Hidden gem with great wines (Susie can skip wine)

porto.name: Café Santiago
porto.note: THE francesinha spot. Long lines - worth it

porto.name: Lado B
porto.note: Half portions available. Ask for extra sauce

porto.name: Adega São Nicolau
porto.note: Keeps standards high despite tourist area

porto.name: Ora Viva
porto.note: Hidden gem - feels like old Porto. Reservations essential

porto.name: Raiz
porto.note: Great for vegetarians too. Views of Clérigos Tower

porto.name: Café Gazela
porto.note: Tiny, no-frills, legendary. Perfect beer snack (for Kim)

freeActivities.name: Walk Alfama neighborhood
freeActivities.description: Wander narrow streets, find miradouros (viewpoints), street art
freeActivities.tip: Morning of Day 2 before food tour

freeActivities.name: Miradouro da Senhora do Monte
freeActivities.description: Best panoramic view of Lisbon - less crowded than others

freeActivities.name: Walk across Dom Luís I Bridge
freeActivities.description: Upper level for views, lower for Ribeira access

freeActivities.name: Ribeira waterfront stroll
freeActivities.description: UNESCO area, colorful buildings, river views

freeActivities.name: Foz do Douro beach & lighthouse
freeActivities.description: Take Tram 1 from Ribeira. Beaches, cafes, relaxed vibe
freeActivities.tip: Backup beach day if Douro train affected

freeActivities.name: Praça do Comércio & Arco da Rua Augusta
freeActivities.description: Grand waterfront square, walk through the arch

hiddenGems.name: LX Factory
hiddenGems.description: Former industrial complex, now creative hub with boutiques, food, bookshop
hiddenGems.whyGem: Unique shopping for Kim - not typical tourist stuff

hiddenGems.name: Livraria Lello
hiddenGems.description: Stunning 1906 bookstore, allegedly inspired Harry Potter stairs
hiddenGems.whyGem: Iconic for photos and book lovers
hiddenGems.tip: Buy ticket online (€8) - redeemable against book purchase. Go early

hiddenGems.name: Pinhão Station tiles
hiddenGems.description: Beautiful azulejo tiles depicting wine harvest scenes
hiddenGems.tip: You'll stop here on scenic train

hiddenGems.name: Feira da Ladra flea market
hiddenGems.description: Lisbon's oldest flea market, Tuesdays and Saturdays

hiddenGems.name: Mercado do Bolhão
hiddenGems.description: Recently renovated historic market, local produce, food stalls

kims_gem.name: Taberna Albricoque
kims_gem.description: Hidden Algarve-inspired tavern by chef Bertílio Gomes. Cockle pastries, oysters, razor clams in garlic. Feels like stepping into old Portugal.
kims_gem.whySpecial: Locals-only vibe, exceptional seafood petiscos, right near train station. Perfect pre-Porto departure lunch spot.
kims_gem.url: Not well-known online - that's the point

photoOps.name: Pena Palace
photoOps.description: Colorful fairytale palace - iconic Portugal photo

photoOps.name: Dom Luís I Bridge at sunset
photoOps.description: Bridge with Ribeira behind - postcard shot

photoOps.name: Tram 28
photoOps.tip: Don't need to ride - just photograph

photoOps.name: Douro Valley terraces
photoOps.tip: Sit on right side going to Pinhão

packingGuide.style: Smart casual. Portuguese women favor understated elegance.

premium.notes: Recommended tier. Boutique hotels, both food tours, fado dinner show, 1st class train. Best experience for business scouting trip.

breakdown.tours: Devour Lisbon ($160) + Sintra ($195) + Porto Food Tour ($155) + Douro Train ($55)
breakdown.transport: 1st class Lisbon→Porto (€95) + Douro RT (€50) + day trips (€20) + departure (€70) + local (€40)

value.notes: Budget-friendly option. Clean, central hotels. Keep Lisbon food tour + Sintra (best business value). DIY Porto food crawl. Fado bar vs dinner show. Promo train fares.

breakdown.lodging: My Story Rossio (€360) + Moov Porto Centro (€320)
breakdown.tours: Devour Lisbon ($160) + Sintra ($195) + DIY Porto food crawl (~$35) + Douro Train ($55)
breakdown.transport: Promo Lisbon→Porto (€40) + Douro RT (€50) + day trips (€20) + departure (€70) + local (€35)

tierComparison.summary: Premium saves $512/person with boutique hotels, all guided tours, dinner fado show, and 1st class train. Value tier offers same great itinerary with smart swaps.

keyDifferences.premium: Boutique hotels with rooftop bars, design details, excellent locations
keyDifferences.value: Clean, modern 3-star hotels, still central, less charm
Lisbon guided tour only, DIY Porto food crawl

keyDifferences.premium: Sr. Fado dinner show (formal, included meal)
keyDifferences.value: Tasca do Chico bar (authentic, €5 cover + drinks)

tierComparison.recommendation: For a business scouting trip, Premium tier is worth it — the guided food tours provide intel they can share with clients, and boutique hotels are properties they might recommend. However, Value tier still delivers an excellent Portugal experience.

openQuestions: Get Delta quote for MOB-ATL-JFK-LIS round trip March 22-31
Verify lodging in CP Maxx for both tier options
Book Alfa Pendular Lisbon→Porto (Promo fare if available for Value tier)
Verify Douro train status for March 29 (track work until April 2)
